auto_apply_on_save.label: Apply VCL On Config Change
auto_apply_on_save.comment: Automatically generate and apply the new VCL when a change is made to the Varnish or Caching options

strip_vcl_whitespace.label: Strip whitespace from VCL files
strip_vcl_whitespace.comment: If whitespace stripping is disabled, generated VCL files will get larger and may exceed the cli_buffer varnish config.

vcl_fix.label: Use VCL fix
vcl_fix.comment: When Enable is selected, a VCL fix will be used to prevent formKey issues. If Disable is selected, an observer will be used.

https_proto_fix.label: Set X-Forwarded-Proto Header to HTTPS on port 443
https_proto_fix.comment: When using Varnish on port 80 and hitch on port 443 for HTTPS, the fix will set X-Forwarded-Proto header to HTTPS to prevent a re-direct loop.

https_redirect_fix.label: Fix HTTPS redirect
https_redirect_fix.comment: When using Varnish as front door listen on port 80 and Nginx/Apache listen on port 443 for HTTPS, the fix will keep the url parameters when redirect from HTTP to HTTPS.

real_ip.label: Use X-Real-IP Header
real_ip.comment: If there is a proxy in front of varnish(e.g. https) and it is not using proxy-protocol (varnish 4.1 only) to communicate with varnish, set this to Enable to replace client.ip with IP from X-Real-IP when comparing to ACLs.

varnish_debug.label: Enable Debug Info
varnish_debug.comment: It is a major security vulnerability, to leave this enabled on production sites

varnish_log_commands.label: Enable Varnish Command Logging
varnish_log_commands.comment: Log all commands sent to Varnish by Turpentine in the log specified (custom if enabled). Caution - can cause logs to grow quickly!

block_debug.label: Enable Block Logging
block_debug.comment: Log block names for adding ESI, only enable when needed to avoid performance hit

ajax_messages.label: Enable AJAX Flash Messages
ajax_messages.comment: Enable fixing the messages block to load via AJAX, disable if you already have an extension that does this

fix_product_toolbar.label: Fix Product List Toolbar
fix_product_toolbar.comment: Enable this to prevent caching the visitor's view preferences of the product list

crawler_enable.label: Enable Site Crawler
crawler_enable.comment: Enable to allow Turpentine to automatically warm the cache

crawler_debug.label: Enable Crawler Debug
crawler_debug.comment: Enable debug info from the site crawler

crawler_batchsize.label: Crawler Batch Size
crawler_batchsize.comment: Number of URLs to crawl per batch, when 0 requests will not be batched

crawler_batchwait.label: Crawler Batch Wait
crawler_batchwait.comment: Time in seconds to wait between batches

use_custom_log_file.label: Use custom log file
use_custom_log_file.comment: Log to custom log file rather than system.log

custom_log_file_name.label: Custom log file name
custom_log_file_name.comment: Only enter a file name, no paths.

server_list.label: Server List
server_list.comment: Should be a list of HOST:PORT pairs of the Varnish management interfaces, one per line

auth_key.label: Varnish Authentication Key
auth_key.comment: Authentication key for Varnish CLI access. This should be the exact contents of the secret file (if used), newlines can be written as \n

config_file.label: Config File Location
config_file.comment: Specify where the Varnish VCL file should be saved

custom_include_file_top.label: Custom VCL File - Top
custom_include_file_top.comment: If this file exists, its content will be prepended to the VCL.

custom_include_file.label: Custom VCL File - Bottom
custom_include_file.comment: If this file exists, its content will be appended to the VCL.

custom_vcl_template.label: Custom VCL Template
custom_vcl_template.comment: If defined and present, this template will be used instead of the default VCL template appropriate for the version of Varnish.

backend_nodes.label: Backend Server List
backend_nodes.comment: A list of HOST:PORT pairs of the backend web servers, one per line

backend_probe_url.label: Backend Check URL
backend_probe_url.comment: URL where Varnish can probe if a node is available. Leave empty to disable probing.

backend_probe_timeout.label: Backend Probe Timeout
backend_probe_timeout.comment: Maximum timeout for requests. If the request takes longer than the maximum timeout, it will be marked as a failed response.

backend_probe_interval.label: Backend Probe Interval
backend_probe_interval.comment: How often to check a backend.

backend_probe_window.label: Backend Probe Window
backend_probe_window.comment: Total number of responses in a window of health.

backend_probe_threshold.label: Backend Probe Threshold
backend_probe_threshold.comment: Number of needed successful responses in the backend probe window.

frontend_timeout.label: Frontend Timeout
frontend_timeout.comment: Timeout in seconds for Varnish to get a response from Magento's frontend

admin_timeout.label: Admin Timeout
admin_timeout.comment: Timeout in seconds for Varnish to get a response from Magento's backend

crawlers.label: Crawler IP Addresses
crawlers.comment: Comma-separated list of IP addresses that should bypass Turpentine's frontend cookie requirement. Also useful for performance testing tools as they also typically don't support cookies. Note - if you are using something like Pound to terminate SSL before Varnish, setting this to the same IP could cause users to end up sharing the crawler session.

crawler_user_agents.label: Crawler User Agents
crawler_user_agents.comment: Comma-separated list of User-Agents (regexes) to serve cached pages to on initial visit

encoding.label: Normalize Encoding
encoding.comment: Simplify the Accept-Encoding header recieved from clients

user_agent.label: Normalize User-Agent
user_agent.comment: Simplify the User-Agent header recieved from clients

host.label: Normalize Host
host.comment: Force requests to be for a specific domain name, will probably break most multi-store setups

host_target.label: Normalized Host Target
host_target.comment: Domain to force requests to, defaults to the domain in the base URL

cookie_regex.label: Normalize Cookie Regex
cookie_regex.comment: Cookie regex to match to override initial cookie domain

cookie_target.label: Normalized Cookie Target
cookie_target.comment: Domain to force cookies to which the regex matches

grace_period.label: Grace Period (seconds)
grace_period.comment: Time for using dirty/expired entries while new copies are fetched and hit_for_pass timeout

url_ttls.label: URL-based TTLs
url_ttls.comment: List of regex (relative to Magento root) and TTL (in seconds) comma-separated pairs (one per line)

url_blacklist.label: URL Blacklist
url_blacklist.comment: List of relative URLs to exclude from caching. The admin section and API are automatically included

bypass_cache_store_url.label: Bypass Varnish if base URL is not found within a store?
bypass_cache_store_url.comment: If enabled any URL in the client that does not start with a store URL will bypass the cache

get_params.label: GET Parameters
get_params.comment: Comma-separated list of GET variables that prevent caching

ignore_get_params.label: Ignore GET Parameters
ignore_get_params.comment: Comma-separated list of GET variables that will be ignored for caching

transfer_unmodified_url.label: Transfer unmodified URL to Backend Server
transfer_unmodified_url.comment: By default the backend server (webserver / magento) gets a modified URL (without ignored get parameters). As a result the ignored parameters can not be used by the backend server for uncachable requests, for example a redirect. By activating this option the backend server gets the the unmodified url, but the cache still uses the modified url for lookups.

exts.label: Static Asset Extensions
exts.comment: Comma-separated list of static asset file extensions

simple_hash.label: Use Simple Hash
simple_hash.comment: Always serve the same version of a static file. Ignore domain, cookies and browser version. Saves memory and lowers cache misses.

customer_group.label: Customer Group
customer_group.comment: Select customer group for different cache content

enable.label: Enable Maintenance Mode
enable.comment: If enabled IP's not in 'developer client restrictions' will receive the following error page

custom_vcl_synth.label: Custom HTML content of vcl synth (error) sub
